newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Riksbank leaves repo rate unchanged at 4.10 pct.
newsitem.headline: Riksbank leaves repo rate unchanged at 4.10 pct.

text.p: Sweden's central bank, the Riksbank, on Tuesday set a one-week reverse repurchase operation at a fixed, unchanged 4.10 percent.
The new operation will run from April 2 to April 9. The lowest accepted volume is 200 million crowns and the highest accepted volume 40 billion crowns.
The market had not expected the Riksbank to change its key interest rate, the repo, at its weekly tender.
A Reuter poll of 10 economists found no expectations of a move with many citing the weakness in the crown as a reason.
The Riksbank last lowered the repo rate on December 17.
The repo rate is the bank's main tool for controlling money market liquidity.
